meanings.definition: (noun) A disease prevalent over a whole country or the world.
meanings.sent1: The news reported on the pandemics affecting many countries.
meanings.sent2: Pandemics like the flu can spread quickly across continents.
meanings.sent3: During the movie, the characters faced a fictional pandemics outbreak.
meanings.sent4: The fear of pandemics loomed over the population like a dark cloud.
meanings.sent5: The history books were filled with stories of devastating pandemics.

meanings.definition: (adjective) Prevalent over a whole country or the world.
meanings.sent1: The pandemic situation required global cooperation.
meanings.sent2: The pandemic response involved multiple nations working together.
meanings.sent3: The pandemic theme park ride was both thrilling and educational.
meanings.sent4: Her influence was pandemic, reaching every corner of society.
meanings.sent5: The pandemic impact was felt by people of all ages and backgrounds.
